description: Republic Square is Yerevan's architectural highlight and the city's most important civic space, designed by Alexander Tamanian in 1924. The square is surrounded by five major buildings built in pink and yellow tuff in neoclassical style with Armenian motifs, including the Government House, History Museum, National Gallery, and Armenia Marriott Hotel.
highlights: Musical fountains performing nightly from 9-11pm with classical, national, rock and pop music from late May to October
Oval roundabout with stone pattern designed to look like a traditional Armenian rug
Pink and yellow tuff architecture creating stunning evening atmosphere
Main site of the 2018 Velvet Revolution demonstrations
Described as one of the finest central squares created in the world during the 20th century
tips: Visit during evening for the spectacular fountain show
Best photo opportunities from sunset through night
Vernissage market is just steps away, perfect for weekend visits
Consider a guided tour to learn about the surrounding buildings' history
vibe: Grand, ceremonial yet welcoming - the beating heart of Yerevan where history, architecture, and modern Armenian life converge in spectacular fashion
